page.title: 19Slurry Dams -Old.
page.content: At the North East corner of the block are landforms which appear rather like rectilinear tumuli. They are old dams constructed to contain waste slurry left from the processing of fluospar and other vein minerals at Cavendish Mill (which is just outside the area, to the north). In the 1960's one dam burst and slurry flowed into Middleton Dale, reaching Stoney Middleton, but the dam was repaired and the material has now largely solidified. Grass and some shrubs and trees have been grown on the surface.
